page.title: 02Customs in Chorley (1)
page.content: Chorley Walking Day. (A) Walking day in Chorley always takes place on the first Saturday in June.It is a time when the majority of the Chorley churches walk in a long procession through the centre of Chorley.They all start walking from their own church. The procession is called a "Procession of Witness" and this is because the people taking part are witnessing that they are members of the Christian Religion having accepted Jesus Christ, the Son of God, as their own personal Saviour and Lord. The procession is always led by St.Lawrence's Church of England as they are the oldest Church in Chorley built in the 1200's and is more usually known as 'The Parish Church'.
